p: Blood transfusion and HBV infection were correlated with T. pallidum infection in females. Females have a higher probability to have a blood transfusion. Blood transfusion represents 5.8% of admissions for birth [ 38]. There is a great percentage of surgically treated females than males who are blood transfused [ 39]. Syphilis may facilitate an acquisition of HBV infection because of its ulcerative infection [ 40]. Lower socioeconomic status of local females may also be a factor [ 41]. HBV infection is endemic in China, and HBV vaccination rates are lower in females than males partly due to patriarchal tradition [ 42].
